name: Dead Hungry Diner
description: Dead Hungry Diner is all about big combos, spells, monsters fighting monsters and finding your flow within the monstrous mayhem!Help Gabe and Gabby, patrons of “The Dead Hungry Diner”, as they feed the creatures of the night buckets and buckets of juicy Brain Berry goop!(Well... that’s the easy part!
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP Processor:1.2Ghz Memory:512 MB RAM Graphics:128MB of video memory, 16-bit or 32-bit color quality  DirectX®:9.0c Hard Drive:80 MB HD space Sound:DirectX-compatible sound

reviews.review_text: Love it love it love it love it!  I played -a lot- of Diner Dash as a kid, and this is like a better version of it! It's colourful, clever, the art style is aweosme. I... I actually do not have one bad thing to say about it.
One of my favorite types of games to play. It's an arcade, point and click game that challenges you to do well. I love trying to keep everything perfect.

This game is pretty good if you like Time Management-style games. It can be a little buggy on integrated graphics cards, but the developer has been a lot more responsive to the issues than some other games I've played recently.
This game will keep you on your waitress/waiters toes. It's kind of addicting lol.
what a fun game reminds me of diner dash a little bit ( ^.^ )

Simply put = Fun for all the family. Muse away a few hours during some fast paced clicky action, with a cute scary theme.   (Diner Dash) in gameplay, but with monsters and ghouls. Reasonably priced too.
It's Diner Dash with Zombies & Monsters. What not to love about that.
I really enjoyed this game and go back and play it randomly. Approrpriate for any age. For me it is a great break from it all. I hope to see another Dead Hungry Diner in the near future.
